abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Structural Adjustment Credit
            Project support the first phase (1985-87) of the
            Government's medium-term adjustment program (1985-92)
            which consists of a comprehensive action program of policies
            and measures aimed at accelerating growth in production,
            employment and strengthening public sector management.
            Specifically, the Structural Adjustment Credit program
            includes the following measures some of which have already
            been taken. They include: (i) agricultural incentive reforms
            to increase cereal production; (ii) steps to decontrol
            agricultural input distribution, free up sector marketing
            arrangements and increase groundnut producer prices; (iii)
            industrial policy reforms; and (iv) implementation of a
            two-year public investment program. The project further
            involves: (v) acceleration of parapublic sector reforms,
            including development of a coherent strategy for
            restructuring and/or privatizing of most state-owned
            enterprises; and (vi) measures to address the underlying
            structural causes of financial disequilibrium. The ongoing
            Technical Assistance Project for Economic and Financial
            Management will assist in implementation of the program.
